name: Flavio Esposito
content: Flavio Esposito, Ph.D. Flavio Esposito, Ph.D. home publications software teaching Saint Louis University Associate Professor Computer Science Research Institute Fellow CS Graduate Coordinator Office: ISE 234D 3450 Lindell Blvd, St. Louis, MO 63103 St. Louis, MO 63103-2007 Email: first DOT last AT slu DOT edu Highlights This year I will be the Travel Grant Co-chair of ACM SIGCOMM 2025. I was the general co-chair of IEEE NetSoft 2024, the 10th IEEE International Conference on Network Softwarization. A wonderful group of colleagues and I had fun hosting the conference in St.Louis last summer. Current Openings I have openings for PhD students, visiting researchers, and a postdoc to work on several cyber-physical systems: if you have expertise and interest in networks, learning, and edge computing, as well as applications of these fields to medicine and agriculture, please apply. Check the HIRING webpage for details. Entrepreneurship Together with my former PhD student Alessandro Sangiorgi, I co-founded Spaghetti Code Labs. Our first product is a Cybersecurity educational mobile app WeeNet that has 5.7M+ downloads. Office: ISE 234D Research interests Most of my research centers on cyber-physical systems and networked systems: network virtualization, network management, Software-Defined Networks (SDN), network architectures and wireless networks. I also enjoy working on interdisciplinary problems, for example, this one or this one. Awards In 2021, I received the Outstanding Graduate Mentoring Faculty Award from the School of Engineering, and I was a finalist for the Undergraduate Mentoring Award in the College of Arts and Sciences. I am grateful for all students that nominated and voted for me. I am currently a Principal Investigator on the research awards listed below from the National Science Foundation (NSF). In the past, I have also received an NSF subaward from the University of Missouri, on an EPSCoR project, and a SLU intramural President's Research Fund Award. I have also received a COMCAST Innovation Fund Award in Jan 2020, and one 150K award from the International Center for Responsible Gaming (ICRG).
